api:note.title: Bootstrapping an fx-customer-api user
api:note.p: Once an access token for a resource owner (user) has been obtained from the OAuth2 server the client can make calls into the API. However the client will not know the person resource representing the resource owner on the system or the customer accounts that the resource owner has access to.

The client can bootstrap into this information by a call to the
'GET /user-profile/self'
end point. The returned resource will contain the details of the user and an array of customer-account-profiles for each customer-account that the resource owner has access to.

p.strong: NOTE : The call to 'GET /user-profiles/self' is intended to be the only call required by client to obtain all the 'static' data for setting up a client interface.

api:note.p: The complete relationship graph should be sideloaded in the response to 'GET /user-profiles/self' via the JSON API included mechanism. For example recursive calls to 'GET /people/self' (that would return the resource corresponding to the resource owner), or 'GET /customer-account-profiles' (that would return all the customer accounts for the resource owner), though valid, should never be required.
